title: Projects
text:
Full Publication
This project focuses on fatty pancreas disease (FPD) — an increasingly recognized yet understudied entity with important implications for long-term pancreatic health.
Using a large US multicenter matched cohort, our team evaluated how radiologic pancreatic steatosis influences future risks of pancreatitis, pancreatic exocrine dysfunction, and pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC).
The findings highlight that FPD is not merely an incidental imaging finding but a potential early marker of future pancreatic disease.
This work represents one of the most comprehensive evaluations of FPD outcomes to date, and serves as the foundation for ongoing efforts to define diagnostic criteria, understand metabolic contributors, and develop risk-stratification tools for clinical practice.

title: Projects
section: Pancreatic Cysts, IPMN Surveillance & Early Cancer Detection
text:
Pancreatic Cysts, IPMN Surveillance & Early Cancer Detection

Full publication
My second major project centers on intraductal papillary mucinous neoplasms (IPMNs) and the challenge of predicting which cysts will progress to high-grade dysplasia or pancreatic cancer.
Across population-based datasets and multicenter clinical cohorts, I have contributed to studies assessing:

the natural history of IPMNs

long-term outcomes after surveillance

risk factors for early-stage PDAC detection

predictors of malignant transformation

opportunities for integrating clinical, imaging, and biomarker data

This work aims to guide clinicians toward more informed decisions about surveillance intervals, surgical referral, and high-risk patient identification. Ultimately, the goal is to help move the field toward earlier detection of pancreatic cancer, when it is most treatable.

Welcome to my website!
I’m Arjun Chatterjee, MD, a Gastroenterology & Hepatology Fellow at the Cleveland Clinic Foundation, where I am also completing a Graduate Certificate in Clinical Research at Case Western Reserve University. My work sits at the intersection of clinical pancreatology, advanced endoscopy, and outcomes-driven research — shaped by early training at the Mayo Clinic, where I served as a Research Fellow in Gastroenterology.
My academic mission is simple: to contribute meaningful, practice-changing evidence in pancreatic disease, with a focus on early detection, high-risk syndromes, procedural innovation, and health-services research. I am deeply engaged in pancreas-focused scholarship: from leading projects in fatty pancreas disease, IPMN surveillance, recurrent pancreatitis, and biliary/pancreatic endoscopy, to presenting at national societies including ACG, DDW, APA, and PancreasFest.
I have been honored to receive multiple recognitions, including selection as a CAPER Pancreas Scholar (2024–26), the CAPER/NPF Visiting Fellowship at UPMC, ACG Presidential Poster Awards, Cleveland Clinic IM Research Award, and multiple National Pancreas Foundation Travel Scholarships. I currently serve as an Associate Editor for the ACG Case Reports Journal and as an #EBGI Social Media Ambassador, reflecting my parallel interest in medical communication and education.
Beyond research, I enjoy creating and sharing educational content through Medical Twitter and YouTube, running my long-standing platform “Curious Cranium”, mentoring international medical trainees, and building digital tools — including websites, video content, and graphics that make complex ideas more accessible.
My long-term goal is to become a clinician-scientist and educator in medical pancreatology, advancing early diagnosis, risk prediction, and minimally invasive therapeutics for pancreatic disease — while contributing to the next generation of trainees through education, scholarship, and mentorship.
Please feel free to contact me if you have any questions or would like to discuss potential projects.

title: Sports, Music & Photography
text:
Sports
I’ve been a lifelong Manchester United football club fan, and following the English Premier League has become a weekly ritual. Whether it’s catching a late-night match, debating tactics with friends, or celebrating a big win, sports give me a sense of excitement and community no matter how busy training gets. It’s my way to disconnect, recharge, and stay connected to something I’ve loved since childhood.

title: Sports, Music & Photography
text:
Music
Music is woven into every stage of my life — whether I’m editing videos, traveling, or winding down after a long call. My playlists range widely: EDM for energy (huge AVICII fan), Indian and Bengali classics for nostalgia, and everything in between for the moments that need their own soundtrack. Music helps me reflect, reset, and keep a sense of rhythm through the ups and downs of clinical life.

title: Sports, Music & Photography
text:
Photography
Photography is where I slow down. Between travel, long weekend walks, and spontaneous adventures, I enjoy capturing the small details and fleeting moments that often go unnoticed. Photos help me remember where I’ve been, who I met along the way, and the simple beauty hidden in everyday life.
It’s not about perfect shots — it’s about collecting stories.
